This looks good, but I've spotted an additional thing that could be improved there. Currently, cleanup looks like this:

     if (!saved_ref) --version_block[2];
     if (--version_block[1]) return;
     delete[] version_block;
     version_block = nullptr;

so the version_block is set to nullptr only if it was deleted (so if a counter decrefed it, but it wasn't freed, it will still keep a non-null pointer). While it's not a problem, it might be easier to debug it if it was changed to be:

     auto vb = version_block;
     version_block = nullptr;
     if (!saved_ref) --vb[2];
     if (--vb[1]) return;
     delete[] vb;

Thanks!
